Articles.Content:
I must say the inbuilt probe cores do feel a bit cheaty when running Remote Tech. They do not require a connection and get listed as 'local control' as if there was a Kerbal onboard. Is there a reason the inbuilt probe cores are necessary? I mean it's not like a probe core and a battery and solar panel are extremely heavy. Overall though, this is a tiny issue and I must say I love te balloons! I use them to lift up rockets to about 25 KM before lighting the first stage ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-06T11:49:06Z" title="05/06/2016 11:49  AM" data-short="8 yr">May 6, 2016</time> by ChainiaC**
  
typo

> 
> 
> 22 hours ago, ChainiaC said:
> 
> 
> I must say the inbuilt probe cores do feel a bit cheaty when running Remote Tech. They do not require a connection and get listed as 'local control' as if there was a Kerbal onboard. Is there a reason the inbuilt probe cores are necessary? I mean it's not like a probe core and a battery and solar panel are extremely heavy. Overall though, this is a tiny issue and I must say I love te balloons! I use them to lift up rockets to about 25 KM before lighting the first stage ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")
> 

They are there because in the original version of KerBalloons, the balloons had a very low lift rating (like up to 0.005t) so they couldn't carry a probe core and science experiment at the same time. I guess I just never removed it but I'll consider it for the next update

Ah thanks! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") Then perhaps I won't feel so wasteful when dumping eight probecores when decoupling all my lifting balloons ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

All the new models/textures for each size coming soon. (The white rectangles are replaced with your flag in-game)

![x5lvZhO.png](http://i.imgur.com/x5lvZhO.png)

~~Hover Compatibility coming soon?~~

~~(I'll stop harping on about this... WHEN I DROP DEAD~~)

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-08T18:14:26Z" title="05/08/2016 06:14  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 8, 2016</time> by Rory Yammomoto**

Was the tweakables in the right click menus axed because of the ui changes in 1.1?

Just wondering as I kind of miss making sure my balloon wasn't going to shoot crazily into the sky and also not just bobbing around on the launchpad.

> 
> 
> 18 hours ago, Squeaky said:
> 
> 
> Was the tweakables in the right click menus axed because of the ui changes in 1.1?
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Just wondering as I kind of miss making sure my balloon wasn't going to shoot crazily into the sky and also not just bobbing around on the launchpad.
> 

It was replaced with an automatic system so you're balloons won't shoot off

I just tried to launch a balloon with a Mk 1-2 underneath but the balloon won't deploy when I click on the deploy button. I'm using v3.1 in KSP 1.0.5.1024. Also I can't seem to control the vessel when the balloon is attached.

> 
> 
> On 5/6/2016 at 7:48 AM, ChainiaC said:
> 
> 
> I must say the inbuilt probe cores do feel a bit cheaty when running Remote Tech. They do not require a connection and get listed as 'local control' as if there was a Kerbal onboard. Is there a reason the inbuilt probe cores are necessary? I mean it's not like a probe core and a battery and solar panel are extremely heavy. Overall though, this is a tiny issue and I must say I love te balloons! I use them to lift up rockets to about 25 KM before lighting the first stage ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")
> 

i have a module manager config i could give you that gives all unmanned probe cores the required RT part module. infact, i dont know why this MM config isnt packaged with RT. i can PM it too you.
im not sure if i've mentioned how much i love this mod but... i love this mod!

> 
> 
> On 21/05/2016 at 5:28 PM, Delta\_8930 said:
> 
> 
> I just tried to launch a balloon with a Mk 1-2 underneath but the balloon won't deploy when I click on the deploy button. I'm using v3.1 in KSP 1.0.5.1024. Also I can't seem to control the vessel when the balloon is attached.
> 

Have you tried it on a clean install with no other mods? That version has over 5k downloads and this is the first time this issue has been reported

Thanks ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
I just tried it on a new 1028 install and everything works fine! Thanks!

So how well do these work on Eve? 

The answer is "not well, but fixable": If I don't change the max pressure in the .cfg to deal with Eve surface pressure the balloons behave very strangely (sink like lead) 

**Edited <time datetime="2016-06-07T12:31:08Z" title="06/07/2016 12:31  PM" data-short="8 yr">June 7, 2016</time> by RuBisCO**

Neat Mod JoePatrick1!![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

If the Balloons can be made to work on the surface of Eve, Could they work on the Surface of Venus?

What Changes to my .cfg would i need to do to make them work? That is, if its even possible.

Eve is Difficult, but Venus is something else entirely!![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif ":0.0:")
Could you move the source code from Dropbox to a GitHub repository? GitHub (if you don't already know) puts everything in a nice little box.

> 
> 
> On 11/06/2016 at 0:10 AM, hieywiey said:
> 
> 
> Could you move the source code from Dropbox to a GitHub repository? GitHub (if you don't already know) puts everything in a nice little box.
> 

I did try but I couldn't figure it out. Any good tutorials on how to use it anywhere?

The ability to hover or atleast be made neutrally bouyant would be great for what I call at sit-a-light

A few spotlights put on an engine set to hover..making an artificial sun..very useful ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
> 
> On 6/15/2016 at 11:44 AM, JoePatrick1 said:
> 
> 
> I did try but I couldn't figure it out. Any good tutorials on how to use it anywhere?
> 

[@CobaltWolf](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/105588-cobaltwolf/) Made a really nice tutorial to help me get started:

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/_iJSPRxRGy8?feature=oembed" width="459"></iframe>

Hi, 

I have been using (and loving) Kerballoons recently (it became quite a mainstay of my atmospheric craft designs especially since the changes to wheels made takeoff and landing harder than ever) turning my fleet into STOL crafts. And cutting costs on <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr> probe launches. 

I wanted to say I met a couple of small bugs. If I quickload a quicksave with a parked vessel on the ground with the balloon inflated (not enough lift to get it off), the balloon tether reloads as very short (or maybe 0 length) and the balloon physically collides with the craft impairing functionality apart from looks. (I was eventually stranded in the badlands because of this ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif ";.;")) 

Another issue I have met is that when using several balloons to lift off heavy craft (I use 2 to 4 high altitude 1.25M balloons on struts to lift orbital probes before conventional rockets put them into orbit), sometimes the lift of the balloons doesn't accumulate as expected and once opening a 4th balloon negated lift of the other 3 dropping everything back to the ground. But this has been infrequent and may have been a glitch. 

Do you need screenshots or logs? 

Also, apart from the much requested hover mode which would be fun. I'd love a parachute like repack feature, or inflate and deflate based on gas tanks/electricity. And lots of people could probably benefit from variable inflation setting at <abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr> or <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> (showing expected lift and burst height)

If you don't like the idea but think it can be made from the base parts you provided and the existing tutorials I'd be glad for a few pointers (I haven't worked on ksp mods yet but I am a C# dev).

Thanks in advance

> 
>

I would imagine some of the bugs you're having are due to the fact I haven't updated the mod to the latest version of KSP yet.

Development has been slow recently due to exams but I have finished now and am continuing to work on v0.4.0 which will be quite a significant update which should fix your bugs. For example loading a craft with a KerBalloon that has already been inflated can be a bit dodgy.

Better support for multiple balloons is already done. The issue your having may have been due to horizontal velocity which limits the balloons lift (this bug is fixed already in the v0.4.0 update)

Other features in v0.4.0 include  

-KerBalloons Catagory in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>/<abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr> (no longer under the science tab)  

-Balloons suitable for Eve/Duna/Laythe  

-Balloons with built in parachutes  

-Repack option (like parachutes)  

-New and improved models and texures  

-Bug fixes

Oh that's great news ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") (Had to hold back from 1.1.3 for now as some B9 parts block during game load anyhow, currently running 1.1.2)

Really glad to hear this, is there an estimated date ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") ? (Not rushing you by any means, just curious)

> 

2-3 weeks hopefully

"-Balloons suitable for Eve/Duna/Laythe"  - Jool?? I would love to build floating landing platform on Jool

Got some time this week to work on KerBalloons. Should be able to get the  update out before I go away on Friday.

Here is the checklist of things to do

![ziFnl1z.png](http://imgur.com/ziFnl1z.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2016-07-24T11:36:46Z" title="07/24/2016 11:36  AM" data-short="7 yr">July 24, 2016</time> by JoePatrick1**

In order to get the update out this Friday before I go away, the parachute balloons are going to have to wait until v0.4.1 (or v0.4.2 if v0.4.1 is a hotfix)

All the new balloons for Duna, Eve and Laythe are now added. Including Kerbin balloons there are now 48 different balloons. (4 planets, 4 sizes per planet, 3 variations per size. 4x4x3 = 48)  

I will be spending the next few days testing and balancing each and everyone of them and then the update should be out.

Here is a screenshot of some of the balloons (with the new models and textures) and below is a video demonstrating the repack option for deflated (but not burst) balloons.

![xhQ9zXk.png](http://i.imgur.com/xhQ9zXk.png)

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/9htRc5fBRKI?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2016-07-25T17:29:55Z" title="07/25/2016 05:29  PM" data-short="7 yr">July 25, 2016</time> by JoePatrick1**
